Sentencas: The use of mesoporous electrodes in solid oxide cells would lead to a significant enhancement of the performance due to their high surface area and large number of active sites for electrochemical reactions.
Titulo: Synthesis and characterization of robust, mesoporous electrodes for solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: However, their application in real devices is still hindered by the potential instability of the mesostructure and morphology at high temperatures required for device fabrication and under severe conditions for high-current, long-term operation.
Titulo: Synthesis and characterization of robust, mesoporous electrodes for solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: Here we report our findings on the preparation and characterization of mesoporous electrodes based on ceria infiltrated with catalysts: an anode consisting of a Ce0.8Sm0.2O1.9 (SDC) scaffold infiltrated with Ni and a cathode consisting of an SDC scaffold infiltrated with Sm0.5Sr0.5CoO3-delta (SSC).
Titulo: Synthesis and characterization of robust, mesoporous electrodes for solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: In particular, a doped-zirconia electrolyte supported cell with a mesoporous Ni-SDC anode and a mesoporous SSC-SDC cathode demonstrates an excellent peak power density of 565 mW cm(-2) at 750 degrees C (using humidified hydrogen as the fuel).
Titulo: Synthesis and characterization of robust, mesoporous electrodes for solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: More importantly, both mesoporous electrodes display remarkable stability, yielding a combined electrode virtual non-degradation for the last 500 hours of the test at a constant current density of 635 mA
Titulo: Synthesis and characterization of robust, mesoporous electrodes for solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: cm(-2) at 750 degrees C, demonstrating the potential of these mesoporous materials as robust electrodes for solid oxide fuel cells or other high-temperature electrochemical energy storage and conversion devices.
Titulo: Synthesis and characterization of robust, mesoporous electrodes for solid oxide fuel cells
